sentences.sContent: I can remember the thrill of not knowing what I would get on Christmas morning.
sentences.sCn: 我记得，在不知道圣诞节早上会收到何种礼物时自己的激动心情。

synos.tran: 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动
颤抖；感到兴奋；感到紧张

words.tran: 毛骨悚然的；令人兴奋的；颤动的
惊险小说；使人毛骨悚然的东西；使人毛骨悚然的小说

remMethod.val: thr+ill (病) → 把人吓得都病了→使毛骨悚然

trans.tranOther: If something gives you a thrill, it gives you a sudden feeling of great excitement, pleasure, or fear
to make someone feel excited and happy
